SPRITES
These values can be used in-game (as cheats or by manually editing memory) to overwrite the sprite set an object is currently using. It will not change that object's behavior. Writing them to 0200491C, as is done here, will re-sprite the palm tree at the top of the tutorial beach (and various things in other levels). This means that you can shake the palm tree and the sprite animates in place--which is useful for aligning sprites after ripping them.

If you're looking for a way to actually change one object to another, then refer to the spawn ids. You'll also need the decompiled ROM to actually find where everything is.

0200491C:08054a20: Invisible
%%%%%%Takua Sprites
%%Running
0200491C:08054a2c: Takua run S
0200491C:08054a38: Takua run SE
0200491C:08054a44: Takua run E
0200491C:08054a50: Takua run NE
0200491C:08054a5c: Takua run N (this pattern holds for all Takua sprites)
%%Hops
0200491C:08054a68
0200491C:08054a74
0200491C:08054a80
0200491C:08054a8c
0200491C:08054a98
%%Long jumps
0200491C:08054aa4
0200491C:08054ab0
0200491C:08054abc
0200491C:08054ac8
0200491C:08054ad4
%%%%Launcher stuff
%%Launcher whip out
